lc.core

Class LinearClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • lc.core.LinearClassifier
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogisticClassifier, PerceptronClassifier

    public abstract class LinearClassifier
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinearClassifier(double[] weights) 
      LinearClassifier(int ninputs) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double accuracy(java.util.List<Example> examples)
      Return the proportion of the given Examples that are classified correctly by this LinearClassifier.
      double eval(double[] x)
      Evaluate the given input vector using this LinearClassifier and return the output value.
      double squaredErrorPerSample(java.util.List<Example> examples)
      Return the squared error per example for this Linearlassifier using the L2 (squared error) loss function.
      abstract double threshold(double z)
      Threshold the given value using this LinearClassifier's threshold function.
      void train(java.util.List<Example> examples, int nsteps, double constant_alpha)
      Train this LinearClassifier on the given Examples for the given number of steps, using given constant learning rate.
      void train(java.util.List<Example> examples, int nsteps, LearningRateSchedule schedule)
      Train this LinearClassifier on the given Examples for the given number of steps, using given learning rate schedule.
      protected void trainingReport(java.util.List<Example> examples, int stepnum, int nsteps)
      This method is called after each weight update during training.
      abstract void update(double[] x, double y, double alpha)
      Update the weights of this LinearClassifer using the given inputs/output example and learning rate alpha.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public abstract void update(double[] x,
                            double y,
                            double alpha)
        Update the weights of this LinearClassifer using the given inputs/output example and learning rate alpha.

      • threshold

        public abstract double threshold(double z)
        Threshold the given value using this LinearClassifier's threshold function.

      • eval

        public double eval(double[] x)
        Evaluate the given input vector using this LinearClassifier and return the output value. This value is: Threshold(w \cdot x)

      • train

        public void train(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                  int nsteps,
                  LearningRateSchedule schedule)
        Train this LinearClassifier on the given Examples for the given number of steps, using given learning rate schedule. ``Typically the learning rule is applied one example at a time, choosing examples at random (as in stochastic gradient descent).'' See AIMA p. 724.

      • train

        public void train(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                  int nsteps,
                  double constant_alpha)
        Train this LinearClassifier on the given Examples for the given number of steps, using given constant learning rate.

      • trainingReport

        protected void trainingReport(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                              int stepnum,
                              int nsteps)
        This method is called after each weight update during training. Subclasses can override it to gather statistics or update displays.

      • squaredErrorPerSample

        public double squaredErrorPerSample(java.util.List<Example> examples)
        Return the squared error per example for this Linearlassifier using the L2 (squared error) loss function.

      • accuracy

        public double accuracy(java.util.List<Example> examples)
        Return the proportion of the given Examples that are classified correctly by this LinearClassifier. This is probably only meaningful for classifiers that use a hard threshold. Use with care.
